reviews.title: Well located hotel for a business trip
reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights at Ibis Basel Banhof, during a business trip. The hotel is well located, close to the central station (where the trains from Zurich airport arrive) and with easy access, via tram, to the rest of the city (the hotel gives a voucher for free public transportation during the stay). Rooms are ample (for European standards) and clean. As in every Ibis, they are not luxurious but you'll find everything you need for a good stay. Breakfast is ok, although, just out of curiosity, I preferred having my breakfast at one of the many places around the station. There's a supermarket nearby, and some fast food at the station, tho not many "real" restaurants at walking distance. I'd say there's a good chance I'll stay here again in my next business trip to Basel.

reviews.title: Simple hotel. Perfectly adequate
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights with family while visiting for a memorial service in Hochwald. The hotel,was clean and someone said it had recently been refurbished. It was perfectly located for basle SBB station. Literally a ten minute walk (although there is a tram that stops right outside if you are not able to walk ( no. 2 from the station)

reviews.title: Nice hotel, excerlant location
reviews.text: You can easily walk to the centre of Basle from this hotel in about 15 minutes where you will find the shops, bars and restaurants. ( or again you can catch tram 16 from right outside). There are trams everywhere and it's an amazing transport system. We were given the mobility card from the hotel on arrival which allows you travel for free on the trams and buses etc for length of yr stay. Brilliant! we even used it to get from the airport and back again. So quick and efficient. Taxis are very very expensive so avoid unless you have to. we had to use a taxi for last part of our journey to Hochwald and it was literally a few miles up a mountain. It was almost 40 CHF and the return was the same! So 80CHF for a 6 mile journey.

reviews.title: Excellent for the price
reviews.text: We didn't have breakfast in the hotel although relatives did and said it was nice. Although to be honest no one checked you had paid for this and you could just walk in and grab a coffee! There is a little snack bar available for beer and coffees etc all day which was nice

reviews.title: Very good value
reviews.text: In summary a simple hotel, clean, modern and quite sufficient for somewhere to lay yr head if that's all,you need. We would use this hotel again if we ever had the need to. Only gripe was the built in hair dryer which wasn't great and plug points not next to the only mirror in the room!

reviews.title: Lovely staff, clean and comfortable - needs better sounds insulation though
reviews.text: I arrived here late at night and too tired to even attempt a foreign language. The front of house staff were incredibly friendly and fluent in English. They immediately put me at my ease and checked me in with no fuss. Gold star. The room was clean, comfortable and everything I needed. The only issue I had was that my room faced the train station and occasionally you could hear the trains and announcements. Next door's tv was also audible to the syllable. Just need a bit more sound proofing to be a great stay.

reviews.title: Great hotel, super location
reviews.text: Booked this location since arrived late in evening and had train out the next morning. The location is excellent; 5 min walk from the train station. Take city/airport bus that drops you off at the main train station. Just walk to the other end of the station and turn right. Hotel very clean, very comfortable, all paper work was ready when I arrived; if want late snack they 24 hr. service, although better walk back to the train station and eat at Hallo restaurant next to train track #14. Ibis Hotel also gives to you free bus pass that you can use all day in city and to airport. Also CoOp very close if you wish to buy grocers, fruit, etc. I take with me a thermos bottle for tea during the day, and hotel staff were happy to prepare it for me. I had another hotel booked for end of trip but cancelled it and came back to the Ibis since so very close to the train station. Bed very comfortable. Best I had during my 10 visit in Switzerland.

reviews.title: Excellent Service, awesome comfort, great staff
reviews.text: I spent three days at Ibis Hotel, Basel on a business trip. It was such a fantastic experience that I can't forget. The front office staff were very cordial, helping, accommodative. They provide Tram pass for throughout the stay that allows transportation within city using Tram. Basel itself is a beautiful place for a vacation, and Ibis hotel just makes it memorable. Breakfast offered veriety of options and was delicious. Rooms were crystal clean. Great hotel overall.

Ibis Hotel was everything I expected. Friendly staff and good breakfasts. Rooms were available and clean and everything was in working order. The Internet worked very well and I really like the mobility pass, that helped me tremendously. The snack food was limited, tasty, and quite expensive. Rooms were small but I expected that.
reviews.title: Good Staff, Good Location, Small room.

reviews.text: Spent 4 nights here with my daughter. Comfortable bed, great shower, no problems at all. Basic, no frills hotel but more than adequate for our purposes. Some traffic noise when window was open, but generally a quiet hotel. Tram pass allowed easy access to city centre. Staff polite and helpful - supplied adaptor, city map and explained tram routes.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Minor quibbles - kettle in room would be useful, but you could get a coffee from the bar to take to your room and would have appreciated a hand towel as well as the bath towel provided. Would stay here again as the rate we got was excellent value for money in an expensive city.
reviews.title: Great hotel with fantastic staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights on business and arrived very late on a Sunday night. Was greeted warmly and checked in effortlessly. I had a van and they showed me the best place to park as it wouldn't fit in car parks. The hotels is very clean and comfortable the staff are great and very helpfull with advice on all things from getting around to where to eat. There are 2 team stops right outside and you are in the centre in 10 mins max. A free tram pass is included in your stay as too in wifi.
reviews.title: Ibis is great value

reviews.text: As with all ibis hotels there are no leisure facilities but I knew that when I booked and wasn't needing any. This is a great place as a base for a city break or a business trip.
reviews.title: Great service, great employee's.
Good value for a business trip
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Ibis Basel Bahnhof Hotel many times on business trips to Basel.

reviews.title: Good for the price
reviews.text: The stuff is very friendly. If you arrive by car, make sure you call before and ask for the parking in the hotel garage. If you call the reception upon arrival they can open you the gate.

reviews.title: Convenient location
reviews.text: There are a few restaurants in the neighbourhood and within a 5 minute walk you are at the train station.

reviews.title: Average hotel
reviews.text: The hotel has a wifi (free in general areas, pay on room) - the rooms are always very clean. All the newer Ibis Hotels in Switzerland (been to Lugano, Locarno, Freiburg) have the same room interiour - so it makes business trips always more comfortable since the room always look the same - you kinda feel at home :)

reviews.title: Great Hotel in Basel
reviews.text: All the Ibis Hotels provides breakfast (pay extra) and most of them have a little snack card.There is no restaurant in the hotel.
